ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] compiling error on Linux
ygData.msgSnippet: The problem is related to gcc version 4.3, since in this version the C++ header dependencies have been cleaned up. I solved the problem adding the standard C++

The problem is related to gcc version 4.3, since in this version the C++
header dependencies have been cleaned up. 

I solved the problem adding the standard C++ header, where I found
message errors.

Michele



Il giorno mer, 09/04/2008 alle 14.12 +0200, Michele Vascellari ha
scritto:
> Hello to everybody!
> 
> I'm compiling the 1.7.0 version on cantera on a linux machine with gcc
> version 4.3.0.
> 
> During the compilation I obtain the following error:
> 
> .......
> g++ -c State.cpp -I. -O3 -Wall 
> In file included from State.cpp:20:
> stringUtils.h: In function ‘int Cantera::intValue(std::string)’:
> stringUtils.h:34: error: ‘atoi’ was not declared in this scope
> stringUtils.h: In function ‘doublereal Cantera::fpValue(std::string)’:
> stringUtils.h:38: error: ‘atof’ was not declared in this scope
> make[1]: *** [State.o] Error 1
> make[1]: Leaving directory
> `/home/michele/stuff/src/cantera/cantera-1.7.0/Cantera/src'
> make: *** [kernel] Error 2
> 
> Thank you for the attention
> 
> Michele
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
